required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Effectiveness of Nasal CPAP and Nasal IMV in Early Rescue Surfactant Treatment in Preterm Infants
clinical_study.source: Zekai Tahir Burak Women's Health Research and Education Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators aimed to compare the efficacy of nasal intermittent mandatory ventilation (IMV) and nasal continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP) in early rescue surfactant treatment in preterm infants.

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of nasal intermittent mandatory ventilation (IMV) and nasal continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP) in early rescue surfactant treatment in preterm infants
primary_outcome.description: If infants needed invasive MV or Required a fraction of inspired oxygen of >40% to maintain the targeted saturation of >88% to 92%, surfactant treatment will give for respiratory distress syndrome (RDS). It means that nasal IMV or CPAP is ineffective.

clinical_study.condition: Noninvasive Ventilation for Respiratory Distress Syndrome

arm_group.description: After 2 hours evaluation: Infants needed invasive MV (mechanic ventilation) or Required a fraction of inspired oxygen of >40% to maintain the targeted saturation of >88% to 92%. Non-invasive surfactant treatment (Curosurf®) 100 mg/kg per dose

After 2 hours evaluation: Infants needed invasive MV or Required a fraction of inspired oxygen of >40% to maintain the targeted saturation of > 88% to 92%. Non-invasive surfactant treatment (Curosurf®) 100 mg/kg per dose

intervention.description: PIP: 15-20 cmH2O, PEEP: 4-6 cmH2O, Inspiratory time: 0.4-0.5 second, Rate: 20-30 /minute

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Gestational age 26-32 weeks
The criteria for failure were met by at least 1 of the following:
- pH: 7.10 and PaCO2: 70 mm Hg
- Recurrent apnea with >3 episodes (Prophylactic caffeine were used in all infants)
- Single episode of apnea that required bag-and-mask ventilation
- PaO2: 50 mmHg with a fraction of inspired oxygen of >0.5.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Major congenital anomalies
- Presence of cardiovascular instability
- Intubation at admission to the NICU
- Consent not provided or refused

facility.name: Zekai Tahir Burak Maternity Teaching Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Zekai Tahir Burak Women's Health Research and Education Hospital
responsible_party.investigator_title: Zekai Tahir Burak Maternity and Teaching Hospital, Ankara
